title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Hi guys, 

Got another 820-3115 logic board with this measurements: 


PPBUS_G3H - 1,4 V seems to be shorted to ground but cant find where.
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS - 1,4V
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS - 1.4V
PPDCIN_G3H - 17V
PP3V42_G3H -3.42V
PPVRTC_G3H- 3.45V
PP3V3_S5 - 3.3
PP3V3_S5 - 0 V ( not shorted to ground)

Is it possible that all that is shorted to ground through CPU?



CPU is getting warm, even hot.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Not really short, as you get 1.4V.
But could have low resistance to ground; post exact value, diode mode and ohm mode too.

"CPU is getting warm, even hot."
This points to shorted high-side MOSFET from CPU power supply.
If you get close to 000 resistance between PPBUS_G3H and CPU coils, remove and check outside Q7510/20/30/50/60 (one by one).

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
PPBUS in diode mode 0.004 and resistance 3.3Ohms


CPU coils u mean L7520/10/50 i guess. If so i get about 4-5 ohms between coils and ppbus-g3h

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
What exact resistance to ground on the CPU coils?
Any other big coil has 004 (apart of CPU)?

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
L7550/10/20 to ground is 1,8ohms. and 0.002 in diode mode. 

Other big coils (diode mode): 

L7100 - 0.004 
L7630 -0.008

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Exact resistance between L7100 and PPBUS_G3H?
If close to 000, then Q7100 is shorted.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Yes. I was getting 0.5 between L7100 and PPBUS. So i replaced Q7100 and now getting 7 ohms ( still not turned on the board). IS that what i have to get? I checked resistance between theese two point on other board (820-3332) and getting over 3Khoms, But thats not working board so i cant take it as right one.


P.S: Pbus now is 2.6V but still seems to be shorted to ground. U7100 getting hot, changed it, now ppbus 3V but u7100 still getting hot.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
STOP to power a board where you clearly see a short!!!

Check resistance between PPBUS_G3H and all big coils.
Remove F7040 and post voltage and resistance to ground at L7030.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: Now i have another problem. No green light. Just put it in ultrasonic to clean all flux. Checked and R7085 is 33 ohms instead of 470Khoms. When remove Q7085 the value becames right. When put new Q7085 again 33ohms.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: Change Q7085...

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Changed Q7085 now R7085 is ok, 470 kOhms. Still no green light. 

Checked R7080/81/85/86 all is ok but seems that magsafe is blocked. ISL ohms between 17/18 and 27/28 are ok (20/4 Ohms)

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: Do you get 3V42 and PPBUS_G3H?

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46724"]Do you get 3V42 and PPBUS_G3H?[/QUOTE]

No, 

all rails are 0V

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Is F6905 OK?
Do you have voltage on it?
DCIN voltage pin 2/U7000?
Did you properly solder Q7085?
Check the same voltages using fake charger, or bench power supply...

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46728"]Is F6905 OK?
Do you have voltage on it?
DCIN voltage pin 2/U7000?
Did you properly solder Q7085?
Check the same voltages using fake charger, or bench power supply...[/QUOTE]

F6905 is ok. No voltage on it. DCIN pin 2 on U7000 0V. With fake magsafe ( i dont have so i injected by power supplu) injected voltage on pin 2 and F6905 let pass voltage through. 


Q7085 is soldered good. 

I am stucked at this point. Seems to be current protection but cant find what is wrong

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Original charger detects leakage and stops to power the board.

Post some voltages around U7000 with bench power supply.
Check if R7010/11 both OK.
Also check for short to ground at U7000 pins.

Post exact value (ohm scale, measured onboard) for R7080/81 and R7085/86.

Please, do NOT quote an entire post visible few cm above; maintain the forum aesthetic...

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
U7000:

Pins:

1/2 - 4.2V
3 - 1.06V
4- 3,4 V
5 - 0 V
6 - 3,4V
7/8 - 0V
9 - 0.5V
10/11/12/13 - 3.4V
14/15/16 - 0V
17/18 -1.4V
19/20 - 4.4V
21 - 0V
23/24 -1.4V
25 - 4.4V
26/27/28 2,4V


I'm injecting 16V. U7100 is getting very hot.


R7011 3 9Khoms R7010 30Khoms so they are ok. 

R7081 -62K R7080 - 99,5K R7086 - 317K

And R7085 - 77Ohms Removed Q7085 And it's now 470 as must be. Changed Q7085 by new one. Now R7085 is ok. Guess it was broken while injecting.


P.S. COnected magsafe and R7085 again 77ohms so Q7085 must be fucked again.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
"I'm injecting 16V. U7100 is getting very hot."
Change U7000 and Q7085 at same time.

Why did you inject 16V, and where???

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: You asked me to post voltage near U7000. As i said before that there is no voltage with magsafe and i dont have false magsafe the only way is injecting:) Right?

message:

Then check for voltages.
I never told you to inject voltage somewhere...

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: thanks, will try it tomorrow.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
Sorry for delay. Changed Q7085 and U7100. Now R7085 is 740kOhms but still no green light and all rails are missing. Magsafe is getting blocked by MLB. 


Well. Checked and it was Q7030 in short. No get magsafe light, PPBUS 1.9V but shorted to ground. F7040 PIN2.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: Your CPU has been dead from the start lol. It should not get hot on a direct short to ground unless it or a high side fet are shorter

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message:
If you get 1.9V, is not shorted.
Probably one high-side MOSFET shorts PPBUS_G3H to a coil of a secondary power supply.
Post exact ohm value for PPBUS_G3H and all big coils.
If problem is on CPU VCORE, you can have dead board now.

title: 820-3115 ppbus low, not turning on
message: Finally sent back logic board to my customer. Too many hours with it. Thanks you all:)
